message.content: Penstemon cobaea is a species of flowering plant in the family Plantaginaceae. It typically grows to a height of 3-5 feet and has a spread of about 1-3 feet. The leaves are dark green and lance-shaped with a glossy texture. The flowers are bell-shaped and can be shades of pink, purple, or blue. They bloom from mid to late summer and are a magnet for hummingbirds and bees. The plant prefers well-draining soil and full sun. It is commonly used in borders, container gardens, and as a cut flower.
